intro: Scaevola macrocalyx, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late winter to early spring. The plant has small, narrow leaves and is typically found in sandy or coastal areas. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils. Scaevola macrocalyx is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
